channel.title: Posts on See Fan Go
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on See Fan Go

item.title: Product Review: Old Soul Soap Company Eczema Cream and Blemish Buster
item.description: Edited from the original that was posted in r/CanSkincare. I have a picture of the side of my face at its worst posted in the comments. tldr: The Blemish Buster and Eczema Cream resolved my sudden skin flareups that weren’t improving with my usual products. Acne and the worst of my new eczema disappeared in less than a week. Product descriptions Both products are made locally in Ontario, with various butters, oils and essential oils.

item.title: Looking Ahead to 2023
item.description: I wrote about checking off goals earlier this year: ğŸš€ Goals for 2022 ğŸ’ª Hit a one plate bench ğŸ… Harvest many tomatoes ğŸ’ Train the cats to go for walks ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Master one dish from each continent âœï¸ Start a (non-tech) blog Unfortunately, we found out the hard way that the Nacho cat hates the outdoors even more than the Taco cat, so they will remain indoors and unwalked. A better goal would probably have been to play more with them.

item.title: PEI 10 Day Travel Guide
item.description: Prelude For a 10 day packing list for September, check out this post. I’ll have an update on how that list worked for me sometime in the future. ğŸ’¡ I started writing out the entire 10 day travel plan (with commentary) as a single post, except it got really long and I was getting antsy. So like we say a lot in software development... ship early, ship often. I'll start with a very barebones overview for each day, and then slowly trickle out the more detailed commentary for each day, and update this post with links as I publish.

item.title: Networking and Interview Notes
item.description: Here are some templates I set up during my last round of job searching, networking events and interviews. I am usually extremely avoidant of responding to messages because they make me anxious and the anxiety only worsens when I put them off. However, with a copy-and-pastable template, it makes it easier to do as routine rather than having to come up with a fresh response each time. After all, if recruiters have tools to automate their process (LinkedIn will literally give me a modal to select if I’m interested or not, like 100% the recruiter didn’t personally handwrite that message for me), why shouldn’t I make things easier for myself too?

item.title: Week of Workouts: PEI Hotel Edition
item.description: One of the things I look forward to the most when I travel is access to a different gym. Since I do all of my workouts at home, and my home gym is mostly barbell based, it’s nice to just have the excuse and the equipment to do something different. The hotel we stayed at (Hampton by Hilton) had all the usual equipment - treadmills, elliptical, recumbent bike, cable machine, kettlebells, medicine balls, dumbbells - that I expect from a hotel gym, but also a stair climber (which I unfortunately couldn’t turn on… I love stairs), and the dumbbells went up to a meaty 75lbs, rather than just the usual 50lbs.

item.title: 10 Days in PEI Packing List
item.description: This has been lightly edited from the original reddit post, which you can see here. I first looked into the one-bag lifestyle during my grad trip, and I’m proud to say that I’ve come a ways since my 65L backpack (checked) onebag days. I’m pretty frugal, and the items certainly reflect that. Hopefully this can help anyone else who feels like they “can’t get into onebagging” because they can’t afford all the cool technical (expensive) items this sub talks about.

item.title: First
item.description: Alright, we’re 9 months into the year and it’s time to take a look at the goals I’ve set for myself, according to my GitHub README. ğŸš€ Goals for 2022 ğŸ’ª Hit a one plate bench ğŸ… Harvest many tomatoes ğŸ’ Train the cats to go for walks ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Master one dish from each continent âœï¸ Start a (non-tech) blog Well, I got stuck at 115lbs for bench (year’s not over yet!
